newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak FinMin 1-yr bond average yield hits 16.8pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovak FinMin 1-yr bond average yield hits 16.8pct.

text.p: Average yield in a Slovak Finance Ministry auction of one-year, 11 percent state bonds on Tuesday rose to 16.812 percent, from 15.868 percent in the last successful auction on May 27, a central bank statement said.
The ministry accepted bids worth 2.480 bilion crowns out of the total demand of 2.8 billion crowns, the central bank said.
In the last auction of one-year state bonds on June 17, the ministry rejected all bids due to the high demanded yields.
The ministry does not set an amount on offer at state securities auctions, nor does it set a minimum or maximum limit price on bids.

It uses T-bills and state bonds as the main tools to cover the state budget deficit, which widened to 7.177 billion crowns in the January-May period of 1997 from a shortfall of 4.692 billion crowns for the first four months of 1997.
